title: No, This Kohl's $5,000 Giveaway Is Not Real
subtitle: Just another day at the "like farm."
author: Bond Huberman
statement: Kohl's offered Facebook users a chance to win thousands of dollars if they shared and commented on a post in June 2020.

title: Free Southwest Tickets Scam
subtitle: Southwest Airlines is not giving away free air travel tickets to those who share and comment on Facebook posts.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Southwest Airlines is giving away free air travel tickets to those who share and comment on Facebook posts.

title: Is Starbucks Giving Away Free Frappuccinos to Anyone Who Yells 'Black Lives Matter' in Cafes?
subtitle: Coupon scams often play on moments of crisis.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: In June 2020, Starbucks was offering free Frappuccino drinks to anyone who shouted "Black Lives Matter" inside their cafes.

title: No, Domino's Is Not Offering Free Online Coupons for 2 Large Pizzas
subtitle: Yet another "free coupon" scam attempted to lure social media users with bogus promises.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The Domino's pizza chain is offering coupons for two free large pizzas to social media users who fill out an online survey.

title: No, McDonald's Is Not Offering 2 Free Big Mac Meals for a Month
subtitle: Yet another "free coupon" scam attempted to lure social media users with bogus promises.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: McDonald's is offering coupons for two free Big Mac Meals to social media users who fill out an online survey.

title: Is This Unexpected Check from a Stranger for Real?
subtitle: Someone you don't know sends you a check, then asks you to deposit it and send some of the money to another party. But the check is counterfeit.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Someone you don't know sends you a check, and then asks you to deposit it and send some of the money to another party.

title: No, UK Is Not Texting Fines for Leaving the House
subtitle: Scam text messages purporting to be from the U.K. government informed recipients they had been issued fines for leaving the house during a coronavirus lockdown.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: The U.K. government has been sending texts informing recipients that they have been issued fines for leaving the house during the coronavirus lockdown.

title: No, Everyone Is Not Winning This 'Disney World Holiday Box'
subtitle: A dubious Facebook post triggered a flood of reader inquiries.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: Disney World is offering "EVERYONE" who shares and comments on a Facebook post one box containing a Disney World Holiday.

title: No, Kroger Is Not Offering a Free $50 'Anniversary' Coupon on Facebook
subtitle: Yet another "free coupon" scam attempted to lure social media users with bogus promises.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Kroger is offering a free $50 anniversary coupon to social media users who fill out an online survey.

title: Is Starbucks Offering $100 Coupons During the COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: Coupon scams are not uncommon - with or without a global pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Starbucks is giving away $100 coupons for use in its cafes during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: No, Red Cross Is Not Offering Coronavirus Home Tests
subtitle: Scams involving the disaster relief organization are unfortunately not new.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: People describing themselves as Red Cross workers are knocking on doors of people's homes and selling what they claim are coronavirus home tests.

title: No, This Alaska Airlines 'Anniversary Offer' Is Not Real
subtitle: The airline is not celebrating its anniversary in February 2020 with a ticket giveaway.
author: Bond Huberman
statement: Alaska Airlines is offering a chance to win two free tickets to users who complete a survey.

title: Is Walmart Offering Via Text Message a $1,000 Coupon for Free Merch?
subtitle: Coupon scams are common ways perpetrators can use technology to deceive people.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Walmart is offering a coupon for $1,000 in free merchandise to people via text message.

title: No, Chick-fil-A Isn't Giving Away Free Meals on Facebook Messenger
subtitle: Probably best to ignore any strange links offering free merchandise.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Chick-fil-A is sending coupons via Facebook Messenger that offer free restaurant meals for one year.

title: Are FedEx 'Set Delivery Preferences' Text Messages Real?
subtitle: In January 2020, members of the public reported receiving suspect SMS messages from scammers pretending to represent the delivery company.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: FedEx customers can receive free "expensive" products from Amazon.com via a text message notification.

title: Is Aldi Giving Away Free Groceries on Facebook?
subtitle: If it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Aldi is giving away a year's worth of free groceries to people who share or comment on its Facebook page.

title: No, Walmart Is Not Offering a Free $50 'Anniversary' Coupon on Facebook
subtitle: Yet another "free coupon" scam attempted to lure social media users with bogus promises.
author: David Emery
statement: Walmart is offering a free $50 anniversary coupon to social media users who fill out an online survey.

title: Did 'Shark Tank' Endorse a Keto Diet Pill?
subtitle: Nobody would ever lie in an ad for a diet product, right?
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A
diet pill was successfully presented on the television show "Shark Tank."

title: Is Kohl's Offering $250 Coupons to Social Media Users?
subtitle: Coupon scams are pervasive on social media.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Kohl's is offering free $250 coupons to social media users.

title: Is Netflix Asking Users to Update Payment Information?
subtitle: A popular phishing scam targets Netflix users.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Netflix is contacting users and telling them to update their payment information, or their accounts will be canceled.

title: Bud Light 'Anniversary' Free 24-Pack Facebook Offer
subtitle: Bud Light is not giving away free 24-packs of beer to Facebook users to celebrate the company's anniversary.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bud Light is giving away free 24-packs of beer to Facebook users to celebrate the company's anniversary.

title: Is Argos UK Giving Away Free Stuff On Its Facebook Page?
subtitle: Always be wary of websites asking for personal information.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Argos UK is giving away free stuff on its Facebook page.

title: Is the 'Purse-in-the-Grocery-Cart' Scam Real?
subtitle: Some forms of crime aren't as easy to pull off as they used to be.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Burglars lure women away from their homes after stealing their wallets at shopping malls.

title: Is a Nigerian Astronaut Lost in Space?
subtitle: This spin-off of the well-known Nigerian prince fee scam sets its sights on outer space.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Nigerian astronaut lost in space needs $3 million to get back home.

title: Cedar Point Free Ticket Scam
subtitle: Cedar Point amusement park warned Facebook users that a digital coupon for free tickets was a scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Cedar Point amusement park is offering digital coupons good for four free tickets.

title: H-E-B $80 Coupon Scam
subtitle: A free $80 H-E-B grocery coupon Facebook offer is just another version of the ubiquitous survey scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: H-E-B is giving away $80 grocery coupons to Facebook users.

title: Are 'PlayJoltz' or 'SmushGame' Legitimate Free Streaming Services?
subtitle: Several spammy posts in June 2019 promoted a streaming service ... but readers shouldn't hand over their credit card details.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: PlayJoltz and SmushGame are legitimate, free video or gaming services.

title: Would Apple Inc. Call Customers to Alert Them to Suspicious Activity?
subtitle: A spoofing scam mimics the appearance of a real phone call from Apple Support - only problem is Apple would never call you without your initiating contact first.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Apple Support would proactively call you to tell you about a suspicious activity associated with your iCloud account or a compromise of Apple ID information.

title: Costco 'Anniversary' $75 Coupon Scam
subtitle: Costco is not giving out free coupons to Facebook users to celebrate the company's anniversary.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Costco is giving out free $75 coupons to Facebook users  to celebrate the company's anniversary.

title: Hy-Vee 75th Anniversary $80 Coupon Scam
subtitle: Hy-Vee grocery stores are not distributing free $80 off coupons as part of an anniversary promotion.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Hy-Vee grocery stores are distributing free $80 coupons online as part of a "75th Anniversary" promotion.

title: Is Ellen DeGeneres Holding a Facebook Giveaway?
subtitle: Don't fall for scams that use counterfeit Facebook accounts to falsely associate themselves with celebrities.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Ellen DeGeneres is offering big-ticket Facebook giveaways for liking and sharing posts.

title: Publix Coupons Facebook Scam
subtitle: A free Publix grocery coupon Facebook offer is just another version of the ubiquitous survey scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Publix is giving away $75 and $80 grocery coupons to Facebook users.

title: Kohl's $150 'Black Friday' Coupon Scam
subtitle: Kohl's department stores are not distributing $150 "Black Friday" coupons as part of an online promotion.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Kohl's department stores are distributing free $150 coupons online as part of a "Black Friday" promotion.

title: Is Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson Holding a Facebook Giveaway?
subtitle: Despite the prevalence of numerous social media come-ons, Dwayne Johnson is not giving away money, cars, or anything else on Facebook.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Dwayne Johnson is giving away money and cars to Facebook users who share a post and click links.

title: Chipotle $100 Gift Card Giveaway
subtitle: Chipotle is not offering free $100 gift cards for National Avocado Day to internet users who share a link with their friends.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Chipotle is giving away free $100 gift cards to internet users who share a link with their friends.

title: Can You Text to 83361 to Receive a Free Target Gift Card?
subtitle: An insidious scam ends not with free gift cards, but with Facebook users involuntarily spamming the groups to which they belong.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Social media users can get a free Target gift card by texting the word "TARGET" to 83361.

title: Text to Receive a Free Walmart Gift Card?
subtitle: An insidious scam ended with Facebook users involuntarily spamming their groups.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: People can get a free Walmart gift card by texting the word "WALMART" to 83361.

title: New Medicare Card Telephone Scam
subtitle: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid are not calling senior citizens and asking for personal information ahead of the launch of a new Medicare card.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Federal authorities are calling senior citizens and asking for personal information, before sending out a new Medicare card

title: Pizza Hut 58th Anniversary Freebie Scam
subtitle: Pizza Hut is not giving three pizzas away to contest entrants in celebration of their 58th anniversary.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Pizza Hut is giving three free pizzas away to Facebook users in honor of its 58th anniversary.

title: 'Free Disney Theme Park Tickets' Scam
subtitle: Disney is not giving away free theme park tickets to those who like and share posts on Facebook; such offers are a form of sweepstakes scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Disney is giving away free theme park tickets to Facebook users.

title: Utility Bill Payment Scam
subtitle: Scammers claim a government grant will pay your utility bill in full for one month, then take your money.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A government grant will pay your utility bill in full for one month.

title: Airline Ticket Giveaway Scam
subtitle: Airlines are not giving away free tickets or spending money to Facebook users who share and like a page.  Those offers are a form of online scam.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Airlines are giving away free tickets or spending money to Facebook users who share and like a page.

title: ALDI Coupons Facebook Scam
subtitle: An offer on Facebook for free ALDI grocery coupons is not legitimate.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: ALDI is giving away free grocery coupons to Facebook users who take a brief survey.

title: $75 Bed Bath & Beyond Coupon?
subtitle: Another Facebook coupon scam has appeared, this time using phony Bed Bath & Beyond coupons to lure users into participating.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Facebook users can receive a Bed Bath & Beyond coupon in exchange for sharing a post or taking a survey.

title: Free Dunkin' Donuts Coupon Scam
subtitle: An online Dunkin' coupon offering that promises a free box of donuts is part of an anniversary giveaway scam.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Dunkin' Donuts is distributing online coupons for free boxes of donuts to celebrate their anniversary.

title: Tiny House Giveaway Scam
subtitle: Multiple like-farming Facebook pages have lured users with the false promise of tiny house giveaways.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: You can win a free tiny house by liking and sharing a Facebook page and post.

title: Southwest Airlines Las Vegas Ticket Giveaway Scam
subtitle: Southwest Airlines is not giving away four tickets to Las Vegas and $5,000 spending money to Facebook users who share and like a page.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Southwest Airlines is giving away four tickets to Las Vegas and $5,000 spending money to Facebook users who share and like a page.

title: SCAM: Luxury RV Giveaway
subtitle: A Facebook page that promises to give away luxury RV's to users who like and share it is a scam.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A Facebook page is giving away luxury RV's to users who like and share their page.

title: Company Anniversary Free Product Scam
subtitle: Businesses are not celebrating their anniversaries by giving away free product to Facebook users who share and like a page.  Those offers are a form of online scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Businesses are celebrating their anniversaries by giving away free product to Facebook users who share and like a page.

title: Nordstrom Gift Card Survey Scam
subtitle: A slicker-than-average Facebook coupon scam is circulating, baiting users with the promise of a $200 Nordstrom gift card.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Nordstrom is giving $200 gift cards to Facebook users who complete three short steps.

title: Wegmans $80 Coupon Scam
subtitle: Grocery chain Wegmans warned Facebook users that a digital coupon was a scam.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Wegmans is offering an $80 coupon to Facebook users who complete a short series of steps.

title: IRS Scam Season
subtitle: Tax season in 2016 triggered a number of novel riffs on common Internal Revenue Service-based scams.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) is contacting taxpayers via e-mail to convey important tax return information, complete paperwork for a refund, or request payment on a balance owed.

title: Is Marlboro Giving Away Cartons of Cigarettes on Facebook?
subtitle: The Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act of 2009 prohibits tobacco companies from giving away free samples of cigarettes.
author: Kim LaCapria

title: Meijer $75 Coupon Scam
subtitle: The Meijer supercenter chain is not giving away $75 coupons to users who like and share Facebook posts; it's a form of survey scam.
author: Dan Evon
statement: The Meijer supercenter chain is giving away $75 coupons to users who like and share Facebook posts.

title: Kroger Free Coupon/Gift Card Scam
subtitle: Kroger is not giving away free grocery coupons or gift cards to Facebook users who like and share a post.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Kroger is giving away free grocery coupons or gift cards to Facebook users who like and share a post.

title: Cashier's Check Overpayment Scam
subtitle: Sellers advertising online are defrauded by "buyers" who pay with cashier's checks made out for amounts in excess of the agreed-upon purchase price and ask the balances be sent to third parties.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Scammers pay with cashier's checks larger than the purchase price and ask the balances be sent to third parties.

title: Lowe's $150 Anniversary Coupon Scam
subtitle: Don't believe what you see. It's easy to steal the colors, logos and header of an established organization.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Lowe's is giving out coupons worth up to $150 to Facebook users to celebrate the chain's anniversary.

title: Home Depot Facebook Coupon Scam
subtitle: Rumor: Home Depot is giving out coupons to Facebook users.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Home Depot is giving Facebook users a sizeable coupon if they complete a survey or share a post.

title: IRS Impersonation Telephone Scam
subtitle: Callers pretend to be IRS fraud division employees and tell victims they owe tax monies that must be paid immediately to avoid arrest or other criminal penalties.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Callers pretend to be IRS fraud division employees and tell victims they owe tax monies that must be paid immediately to avoid arrest or other criminal penalties.

title: You Will Not Use Head and Shoulders Shampoo After Watching This Video
subtitle: Scam bait video purportedly shows the deleterious results of using Head and Shoulders shampoo.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Video shows the deleterious results of using Head & Shoulders shampoo.

title: Dun & Bradstreet Customer Complaints E-Mail
subtitle: E-mail phishing scam poses as notifications from the Dun & Bradstreet Credibility Corp.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An e-mailed notification about customer complaints from the Dun & Bradstreet Credibility Corp is legitimate.

title: 'Parcel Delivery Service' Telephone Scam
subtitle: Notification of attempted delivery cards from a phony 'Parcel Delivery Service' were used as part of a premium rate telephone scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Cards from a "Parcel Delivery Service" notifying recipients of parcels awaiting delivery are part of a premium rate telephone scam.

title: Free JetBlue Tickets Scam
subtitle: "Any contest or sweepstakes JetBlue runs would be hosted on an official JetBlue channel."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: JetBlue is giving away free air tickets to Facebook users.

title: 'Distressed Stranger' Scams
subtitle: Strangers pretend to need cabfare to get to a hospital or money to buy gasoline or baby formula in common panhandling scams.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Strangers pretend to need cabfare to get to a hospital or money to buy gasoline or baby formula.

title: Free Starbucks Gift Card Scam
subtitle: Promises of free Starbucks gift cards to Facebook users are part of a long-running online scam.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Starbucks is awarding social media users free gift cards who click, like, and share Facebook posts.

title: Nigerian (419) Scam
subtitle: Scammers offer to give away free money for helping them move large sums to American banks.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A wealthy foreigner who needs help moving millions of dollars from his homeland promises a hefty percentage of this fortune as a reward for assisting him.

title: Restroom Purse Theft Warning
subtitle: Thieves steal women's purses from restroom stalls, then burgle victims' empty houses when victims go to retrieve their 'found' handbags.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Thieves steal women's purses from restroom stalls, then burgle victims' empty houses when victims go to retrieve their 'found' handbags?

title: Package Pick-Up Scam
subtitle: Scammers dupe victims into paying 'security keeping fees' to receive courier parcels supposedly containing large checks or other valuables.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Scammers dupe victims into paying "security keeping fees" to receive courier parcels supposedly containing large checks or other valuables.

title: Delivery Courier Scam
subtitle: A scammer used debit card information gleaned during delivery of unordered 'gifts' to make unauthorized ATM withdrawals.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: A scammer used debit card information gleaned during delivery of unordered 'gifts' to make unauthorized ATM withdrawals.

title: Does the IRS Send Unsolicited E-Mails About Tax Refunds?
subtitle: Notices purporting to come from the Internal Revenue Service make good phishing bait, for a number of reasons.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A notice from the IRS indicates the recipient is eligible for a tax refund.

title: Valentin Mikhaylin Appeal
subtitle: Frauds like these succeed because those perpetrating them frame their solicitations as heart-rending stories about suffering.
statement: A student in Russia named Valentin Mikhaylin needs your financial assistance to heat his apartment, buy food, and provide medical care for his ailing mother.
